without using cancel ofc
numpad cancel is a 1f jump
so yay
Assuming you let go of shift lightly

oh :o
numpad cancelling is how I got through the cancelling portions of this game.
so you can 1 frame off the floor like that?
numpad cancelling is complicated
is there like a tutorial for this? I think not
it's not quite the same as shift cancel ez
which shift cancel isn't ez if you don't have the right keyboard
unlie numpad but ye
unlike*
and no there isn't, I uh had to look around to learn numpad cancelling
and a lot of it was trial and error
and welowas helping

oh whatever, i'm not in the mood to play JC games again ever
shift cancelling is easier to learn, just get the right keyboard and you're free.
I cant just get a new keyboard so easy
ikr
tfw
my instructions of cancellign methods go beyond 500 word limit of twitch

Hold LShift then numpad 0, then move a bit with left arrow key, then let go of numpad 0, then release LShift at the perfect timing and hold left. you have to be in falling animation before you let go of numpad 0 or you'll jump again  ^ This is how you do K3 starter crystal

K3 secret 2 final save. Hold LShift then right arrow key then numpad 0, 2f release LShift when at the edge and keep numpad 0 held throughout the whole jump, then turn around with left arrow key and then hold LShift.

Regular cancel technique = Hold LShift then hold numpad 0, then when you tap a directional key you will 1 frame cancel in that direction, including if you let go of LShift very lightly. Followed by a full jump while numpad 0 is held you will do a full double jump afterwards, but if you let go of numpad 0 you will do a small 1 frame double jump instead.
Another technique (one I originally learnt) = Tap LShift and Numpad 0 in virtually the same frame, LShift first then Numpad 0, or both at the same time.
and those are like thet echniques
the techniques*
I'd copy and paste them into some sort of document and save it so it's more readable
But essentially, your numpad acts as holding another shift in advance.
I saved them, thanks a lot
np :D
Once you understand numpad cancelling it's as easy as shift
It's just learning it is uh
yeah
there is a new-ish technique I didn' tmention in those posts
IF you do a small double jump and then hold shift asa you go down past double jump, you can then hold numpad and then let go of shift very lightly and do a 1f jump that way.
This method is sometimes very useful but it's rarely used.
I do use it on scramble
the only one I knew was tap LShift and num0 at the same time, but it doesnt work on the ground in water or in platforms
Yeah, that one is the standard variant you learn first.
That one isn't the variant you'll be using the grand majority of the time.
numpad has far more powerful uses than tapping at the same time suggests
here's a cool example, hold shift then numpad then let go of shift lightly. voilla you've done it without tapping at the same time.
